name: Wonder Creek (Lancaster Falls)
description:
Wonder Creek starts about 150 feet from the first waterfall, Upper Lancaster Falls. It’s part of the Starvation creek complex of waterfalls.

Watershed: 0.2mi^2. Likely spring-fed.

Approach

Park at the Starvation Creek St Park pull off and walk the old highway to the 400 trail split off - at Hole in the Wall Falls. Walk the trail past Lancaster falls and proceed up the hillside about 1/8 of mile after the falls. Go up the gulley until you reach about 900 feet elevation and then proceed to the creek. It is a spring so it literally starts on the hillside

Descent

Walk the east side of the creek until you arrive at the lip of the first drop. There is little room for more than 4 people.

  • R1- 50ft from a tree DCR - be very mindful of the rock situation. Everything is crumbly so be neat in your descent.
  • R2- 210ft from a tree DCR.
  • R3- 110ft from a tree DCL.

Exit

Walk back the way you came

Red tape
